intro: Riedelia hollandiae, commonly known as the Holland's riedelia, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
